visual_description.scene: two test tubes held by hand on dark background, horizontal position
visual_description.view: top view of lying test tubes, close-up of bottom part

plasma.color: transparent with yellowish tinge; clots from pale yellow to orange
plasma.notes: compact rounded clots visible at bottom of both test tubes; left test tube (21.6.2) -- clot is smaller, pale yellow/cream, more loose; right test tube (19.6.2) -- clot is larger, with pronounced orange-brown center and light periphery; liquid fraction in both test tubes is nearly transparent; dark equipment visible in background

visual_description.scene: six test tubes lying horizontally parallel to each other on light surface
visual_description.view: general top view, all six samples visible

plasma.color: from transparent to pale yellow; clots from whitish to orange
plasma.notes: clots of various sizes and colors visible in all six test tubes; top (21.6.2) -- small light clot; second (0.6.2) -- whitish scattered inclusions; third (19.6.2) -- large clot with orange center; fourth (21.6.1) -- small whitish inclusions; fifth (0.6.1) -- small pale clot; sixth (19.6.1) -- small yellowish clot; liquid fraction in all test tubes is nearly transparent; glass test tubes, no marking on visible side

visual_description.scene: three test tubes held by hand on dark background, spotlight from the left
visual_description.view: side view at an angle, test tubes slightly tilted

plasma.notes: left test tube (21.6.1) -- plasma is yellow, small whitish clots/sediment visible at bottom, least filled; middle (0.6.1) -- plasma is yellow, medium-sized whitish clot visible within liquid; right (19.6.1) -- plasma is more saturated yellow, rounded compact yellowish clot visible; all test tubes are glass; white label visible at bottom of left test tube; point light source (flashlight) creates glare and overexposure on the left
